reviews.text: at only 50 meters from the Sevilla's core this good hotel is the best you can find in Sevilla. Rooms are large and clean there is a restaurant or only a breakfast. whit 22 /25 euro a taxi cab will carry you from the airport to the hotel that lies in a side were the street are very narrows. No traffic in the road near the hotel make your sleep whitouth problems. A card allow you to go in or out at any time, any way a person is still present and help you also for tourist maps and suggestions. A good and inexpensive four stars hotel at the price of three stars. Only one bad thing : the shower whit a tent and not in a glass box .

reviews.text: This hotel really made the trip for us....amazing location/great little pool for an afternoon dip and clean fresh rooms. Our room was 223, we found it very modern and up to date. There are no English channels on TV but so what...you're not in Seville to watch TV and the noise from the bells of the city are all part of the experience. We could hear noise from the corridors outside but that's because they are stone...and if we heard noise it meant it was time to get up as it was only the cleaners outside starting their jobs for the day!

reviews.text: We stayed for only 2 nights at Husa Los Seises, during our honeymoon in Spain recently. From the tripadvisor reviews we were afraid of the standards of this hotel. But when we arrived there, we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel upgraded our standard room to a honeymoon suite. The female receptionist was really, really warm and helpful and speaks good english. She took the trouble to bring out the map and explained to us the places of interest within Seville (all was within walking distance from the hotel).
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: I picked this hotel for the location - right in the historic center of Seville but on a quiet street away from the crowds walking and talking. I also picked it for the trendy non-traditional style, the rooftop pool and terrace with a view, the interesting architecture and design, and the garden dining/bar area. Really everything I wanted at an affordable price.The room was large, the bathroom was huge, the bed firm (I prefer that, but some won't). There was a separate sitting area, safe, aircon, minibar. My only complaint was the paid wifi in the room. Almost every hotel has free wifi now. The lobby-area wifi was free but limited to 30 minutes. It seems every room had a different layout. Mine faced a big light shaft, but that was just fine. Some rooms had private terraces. As pointed out by others, there is some noise from inside the hotel, but it's not much of a problem unless you are very sensitive. Overall, this is a really good hotel worth staying at, but to be honest, it is getting a little shabby around the edges. It just needs a little TLC and sprucing up. By the way, try The Duplex tapas resto-bar on the corner by the hotel. Really good and popular with locals.
reviews.title: Really nice but needs a little rejuvenation
Avoid at all costs - rip off!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I visited this hotel in August, and because we knew that it would be very hot booked a hotel with a roof top swimming pool. However on arrival at the Husa Los Seises they claimed that we were not booked into the hotel (even though I had already paid!) and we were put in another hotel 5minutes down the road, another in the same hotel chain. The other hotel was extremely basic and there was no swimming pool. We were told that we would be refunded for the night's stay but two months later there is no sign of this money. The other hotel was definitely not worth the same amount of money as I had paid for the Husa Los Seises. I would not stay here again for risk of the same thing happening. The receptionist didn't seem to see my issue and was certainly not apologetic. Perhaps it happens often!

Good for walking to everything you want to see. Very difficult to find in the car... As written previously, we rented a taxi and followed it... Was worth the 14 euros to relieve the stress. The hotel receptionists were really nice. We had 2 rooms 210 and 228. 210 was ok but was under the rooftop restaurant and every chair or table movement scratched above till 2 am.. Room 228 bathroom was awful, old, broken tiles and black dirty/old grouting. Beds were really hard so neither of us enjoyed our stay there. Parking was 20 euros a night. We should have stayed outside of Seville and got a taxi in ..it would have been cheaper and more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good location. Noisy and tired hotel.
Great Location, Poor Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location in the old quarter of Sevilla. Check in service was good and the staff very helpful. However, we were very disappointed with the standard of the room and bathroom. The floor was dirty, the bottoms of the curtains were dirty, and the bathroom had many cracked tiles, missing grouting, mould, and some cracks in the bath. In general the bathroom was very outdated. The corridoors to the room were bland and looked like what we imagine prison corridoors would look like. The hotel literature states that this hotel has been recently renovated but we saw no evidence of this. The view of the Cathedral from the roof terrace is great, but the terrace was not somewhere you would want to sit, with old furnishings, dirty paintwork, dirty cushions, and hardly any shade. There are better hotels in this area of Sevilla for the same price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is quite a nice quirky hotel with interesting rooms and features. To be honest I found the rooms a little too quirky but my wife liked them. The biggest negative about the room is that we were supposed to have a double bed but there is no way they can class it as a double, it was very small and closer to a single bed... luckily no arguments with the wife! There is a roof top pool with nice views. It's a nice place to go for a quick dip and although it's small it did it's job as we were not there to sunbathe.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I would have to try very hard indeed to think of a complaint about this hotel, after a really comfortable relaxed stay. Having read some of the Tripadvisor mentions of noise, we asked for a quiet room, away from the bar and restaurant, and were given room 205 on the second floor. I am a very light sleeper, and I can honestly say I haven’t slept that well in years – I didn’t even have to wear earplugs in bed for once. Lovely large firm beds, and a spacious, nicely-decorated room and en suite bathroom. The rooftop pool wasn’t particularly large, but we didn’t want to do Olympic-style laps, just take a dip somewhere cool with a stunning view of the Giralda, so it was perfect for our needs. The pool closed at 8pm and the rooftop became a bar, closing around midnight.
reviews.title: Comfort and relaxation in a beautiful setting
stay at husa los seises
reviews.text: The location really couldn’t have been better. It’s not easy to get a car to the door (although frankly that’s true of most of Seville’s centre) but it is possible, and it’s perfectly easy to find, for all but the most incompetent map-reader. Turn left and left again, and there you are at the Cathedral, with all its surrounding bars and shops. However, being down a side street insulated it from the noise and bustle. And the staff were pleasant and friendly without being obtrusive.

I suppose ideally it would have been nice to have free wi-fi in the rooms – it was only free in the bar and lounge, but that’s only a niggle. I can’t say that it was a great hardship to catch up on my emails in a shady terrace garden, whilst sipping a cold beer at the bargain price of 1 euro.
reviews.title: Centrally located hotel, but hard to find

reviews.text: Would absolutely stay here again, and I’ve already recommended it to several friends – a top holiday find.

reviews.text: Excellent location, just behind the cathedral. All the major sights in historic Sevilla within walking range. You can enjoy the sight of the Giralda from the hotel pool. The pool itself is convenient if not overly big. Nice room, friendly service (they took care to park my car in the hotel's garage, not an easy undertaking).
